Convert "messy" raw data file to "tidy" raw data file

Source: R/pupil_read.R
pupil_read.Rd

This function converts a "messy" raw eye-tracker data file to a "tidy" raw data file.

pupil_read(file, eyetracker = "", starttracking.message = "default",
  starttracking.match = "exact", subj.prefix = NULL,
  subj.suffix = NULL, timing.file = NULL, subset = "default",
  trial.exclude = c())

Arguments

file

A file path to the raw data export file
eyetracker

Which eye-tracker system was used to record data?
starttracking.message

Message used in SMI experiment to mark StartTracking inline
starttracking.match

Should the message string be an "exact" match or a "pattern" match?
subj.prefix

The unique pattern prefix (letter(s) and/or symbol(s)) that comes before the subject number in the data file
subj.suffix

The unique pattern suffix (letter(s) or symbol(s)) that comes after the subject number in the data file
timing.file

File location and name that contains timing information for message markers
subset

Which columns in the raw data export file do you want to keep
trial.exclude

Specify if ther are any trials to exclude. Trial number

Details

Different eye-trackers will save the raw data file using completely different organizations and naming conventions This function will create a "tidy" raw data file that has a standard organization and naming convention, regardless of which eye-tracker was used. Supported Eye-Tracker Systems: Sensomotoric Instruments ("smi") and SR-Research EyeLink ("eyelink")
